New Records: De'Aaron Fox scored 109 points over a two-game span, passing DeMarcus Cousins for the most in franchise history.
Key Match Events: De'Aaron Fox made his first seven shots from the floor, including three 3-pointers in the first quarter.
The Kings trailed 89-78 in the third quarter but took a 118-116 lead on a Jordan McLaughlin 3-pointer with 1:04 remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin Huerter had 18 points, and Trey Lyles added 17 for the Kings.
Lauri Markkanen had 25 points, Keyonte George scored 19 and Collin Sexton added 18 for the Jazz.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings host the Atlanta Hawks on Monday, while the Jazz continue their five-game trip against the Los Angeles Clippers on Sunday.
Others: The Kings made 19 of 41 shots, or 46.3%, from beyond the arc. The Jazz shot 12 for 26, or 46.2%.
